name: ebullience
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being full of energy and happiness: As he sat slumped on the sofa, his natural ebullience had evaporated. Colleagues and audiences admired her youthful ebullience. See
ebullient
More examplesFewer examplesThere's no denying the melodic genius and sheer ebullience of this music.The energy and ebullience of her singing conquered everything.His biographer captures the ebullience of life in an immigrant neighbourhood in the 1920s.
